channel.title: Welp, here's another
channel.description:
http://soundcloud.com/uncle-cid/before-ableton-asploded-again
I have to get a legitimate copy of Ableton or something. I'll be in the middle of working on something, then all the components will start flashing and disappearing... then finally the application blows up. The rest of my programs, including Windows as a whole, start being buggard, and audio doesn't work on some/all things.
Anywho, after 3 days, how'd I do? I'm only impressed by the drums, but they were good samples. I didn't get to EQing or making the synths sound exactly what I wanted them to be like.

item.title: Welp, here's another
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I stopped using Massive because I thought that was 90% of the crashing problem (it was, but Ableton still shits). Sytrus/FM8, Oatmeal are what I used for this one.

Like I said, not done yet x) Ableton didn’t allow it. Waiting on a new hard drive and monitors for now.

Read full topic

item.title: Welp, here's another
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

I produce dubstep in FL Studio, I have Ableton but never really learned how to use it. What VST do you use? NI Massive? I can supply some pretty badass samples if you want.

And a tip: In the beginning (or any part of a song), I would NEVER leave the drum samples playing without anything behind them as people can easily steal your samples. Maybe have some quiet white noise or some atmosphere or something

Got skype or somethin? could give ya some pointers too

Read full topic

item.title: Welp, here's another
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Yeah, there’s not much variation. I’m totally unable to use Ableton at the current moment. I may reformat the PC when my new HDD shows up. We’ll see.

Read full topic

feels slow.
